com.storytron.swat.verbeditor

Class StateStack

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.storytron.swat.verbeditor.StateStack

  • public final class StateStack
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements a state stack for verb editor.

    This class contains actions for navigating backward and forward the state stack (backwardAction and forwardAction). These actions are enabled disabled as appropriate when there are no valid states in the corresponding direction.

    When editing verbs you can call pushState() to insert new states in the stack, and you can call updateStackActions() to enable/disable the navigation actions as needed.

      Tells if the pushState() operation is set to do nothing.

        public void initStates()
        Once verb editor is started this method must be called to insert the first state in the stack.

      • pushState

        public void pushState()
        Call this to insert the current state of verb editor in the stack.

        This operation has no effect if isIgnoringPushState() returns true.

      • updateStackActions

        public void updateStackActions()
        After editing the verbs, call this method to enable disable the stack actions as appropriate.
